reviews.title: Good trip to Barcelona

reviews.text: places in Barcelona. We had no trouble with the room, a studio. The electric cooker was out of function, but instead there was
reviews.title: We were robbed here!!!

reviews.text: a micro wave oven that did function. No problem for us. And we were not bothered by the noise from Las Ramblas.
reviews.title: great location and ammenities

reviews.text: Stayed here for a long weekend with a group of girls and couldn't have been more pleased with the accommodation. we had a one bedroom apartment which had a double bed and a sofa with a pull out bed beneath it so it was quite a sturdy bed (not the usual rickety camp bed you'd expect). Dining table and chairs, lots of cups and cutlery etc, a mini dishwasher (nice!) fridge, toaster, kettle so if you were mad enough to eat in you could. Bathroom had a good powerful shower (with shower curtain - agree with an earlier reviewer that it's a luxury!) hairdryer was fine although precariously placed above the loo so close the lid first just incase you drop it! ah yes, tv (with a few english language channels) and a cd player and a free safety deposit box. Towels were included.
reviews.title: Perfect location and great apartments!

likes.liked: — Very well equipped and excellent location

reviews.text: It's my understanding that the apartments aren't cleaned/sheets changed etc during your stay but I guess if you're staying longer they will do this for you. It's quite normal in Spain for hotel sheets to be changed just once a week, and let's face it environmentally it makes sense too.
reviews.title: Dont stay here!

reviews.text: Location wise it's perfect, roughly halfway along the Ramblas, opposite the Boqueria market and the Liceu theatre. Close enough to explore the Barri Gotic, Cathedral, Placa Catalunya etc without taking the metro or a taxi, and about 30 minute walk to Barceloneta beach.
reviews.title: Why Stay Anywhere Else?

likes.liked: — The fact that it includes a complete kitchen and the studio is roomy.

reviews.text: I hope to return to Barcelona again very soon and will definitely be booking in here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Citadines is on Las Ramblas only a few minutes walk from Placa Catalunya. Great position and areas such as the beach, Gothic Quarter and Las Gracias are all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — In Spain smoking is allowed in the hotel bedrooms and our room smelt of smoke. We did ask for a non smoking room but not sure if they exist in Spain.

reviews.text: Our room was in the second building so did not look out on Las Ramblas. It was a good size and the kitchen has everything you need if you want to do some cooking. Really we spent very little time in our room as there was so much we wanted to see in Barcelona. The bed was a sofa bed with a pull out bed underneath. Not the most comfortable bed in the world but we were only there for 2 nights so this didn't bother us. Towels are provided and there is a hairdryer in the bathroom. There is a 24 hour reception and the staff were approachable and helpful. If you want breakfast it is 13 euros. Bit pricey but lots of choice and the dining room looks over Las Ramblas so you can spend ages eating and watching other people going to work. Bliss.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Loved the Citadines
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our stay. As other people have said Barcelona is an expensive city and The Citadines, for its position, offers a good deal. We wanted to visit all the Gaudi buildings and other attractions and the entrance costs for these places soon mounts up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friend and I stayed here during the last weekend in January, we had a great time and found these apartments to be in a great location with easy access to most of Barcelona, as two girls travelling we were pleased with the 24 hour reception, which was manned by friendly, helpful staff (except one, who seemed to take a dislike to my friend!). The rooms were great, they were clean and tidy with plenty of space. We found the rooms very warm and couldn't work the air conditioning, but this wasn't a problem as we could open the window without worry as we were so high up.
reviews.title: Overpriced, but what's an American in Europe to do these days?

likes.disliked: — Fold-out couch served as the bed.

reviews.text: We have just returned from a city break to Barcelona. Having been there many times we always wanted to try an apartment.
reviews.title: In the middle of La Rambla

description: Situated in the heart of the city, this property is ideal to enjoy one of the best areas for shopping and leisure and to access easily any point in and around Barcelona. Citadines offers apartments (1-4pax) or studios (1-2 pax) in a comfortable and functional environment, equipped with sofa beds or traditional bedding, full kitchen and its appliances, bathroom, TV, HiFi and free connection to Internet.
